Disc 7: Nebraska (Columbia QC 38358, 1982)

Disc 8: Born in the U.S.A. (Columbia QC 38653, 1984)

---------------------------------------------------------------------

Bruce Springsteen release The Album Collection Vol. 1 1973-1984, a new box set of his first seven albums, on November 17 via Columbia Records/ Legacy Recordings. All of the albums are newly remastered from the analogue master tapes. Acclaimed engineer Bob Ludwig, working with Springsteen and longtime engineer Toby Scott, has remastered these albums, all newly transferred from the original analogue masters using the Plangent Process playback system.
While Born to Run and Darkness on the Edge of Town were both sonically upgraded for remastered box sets in recent years, this box set marks the first time that remasters have been made available for the remaining albums in SpringsteenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s catalogue through 1984 since their initial releases on CD.

All albums are presented in their original album sequences, with no additional material.  The box continues SpringsteenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s relationship with Bob Ludwig, whose work with the artist dates back to 1982Ã¢â‚¬â„¢s original release of Nebraska.  Ludwig also previously handled the Born to Run and Darkness box sets.
